other_tests.findings: In Patient 1, GH levels were low during spontaneous hypoglycemic episodes. In Patient 2, GH levels were low during episodes of hypoglycemia and GH response during stimulation tests was also low.
other_tests.changes_over_time: In Patient 1, GH deficiency resolved by 8 months of glucocorticoid replacement; in Patient 2, GH replacement was stopped at 3 years after GH responses were found to be normal.

other_tests.findings: Suggested septic arthritis of the left knee without underlying osteomyelitis.
Initially revealed a normal hypothalamus, stalk, and pituitary; adrenal cortex could not be identified.
Adrenal cortex could not be identified.
In Patient 2, GH responses were low, confirming GH deficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: GH injections were withheld, and stimulation tests showed low GH responses; GH treatment was restarted.
